result.name: the-national-employer-skills-survey-ness-2003-2009
result.notes: The National Employer Skills Survey for England (NESS) was a survey carried out biennially in England by the Learning and Skills Council.  In 2009, as part of continuity measures after machinery of government changes, the survey was taken over by the UK Commission. The survey covered many of the measures which have been transferred into the UK-wide survey.   These include recruitment and retention problems, demand for skills, skill gaps, workforce development and training, and business strategy and structure.

organization.name: uk-commission-for-employment-and-skills
organization.title: UK Commission for Employment and Skills

result.title: The National Employer Skills Survey (NESS), 2003-2009

extras.value: This survey ran from 2003-2009..  The Employer Surveys Data Tool (http://nessdata.ukces.org.uk/ness/KMS/News.aspx) allows all the historic NESS data to be analysed without the need for statistical software.   Previous NESS datasets are also available via the UK data archive (http://data-archive.ac.uk/). NESS 2009 is available in the ONS virtual microdata laboratory for data linking in a secure setting.
